dismissalComment.html: Welcome back, Akila Dananjaya! Dangled up outside off, full, breaks in, dips, creating distance between the bat and the pitch of the ball. Mithun can only pop it in the air to Kusal Mendis at straight midwicket

dismissalComment.html: Got him!! He went back looking for the cut due to the flatter trajectory and the line outside off, but it spun back sharply and took the top off much to Sri Lanka's elation. Bangladesh in trouble but this pitch is already playing tricks

headshotImage.caption: Soumya Sarkar headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Soumya Sarkar headshot

dismissalComment.html: Soumya misses a full-toss has been given out lbw by umpire Hannibal. Wide of the crease, full-toss, slanting in from round the wicket, Soumya plays all around it and is pinned on the front pad in line with middle. This would have crashed into leg stump and Soumya has to exit. Soumya pondered over a review, but rightly decided against it in the end

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal b Udana 19 (31b 2x4 0x6) SR: 61.29

dismissalComment.html: Tamim has chopped on! Shortish and wide outside off - possibly wider than a set of stumps outside off - Tamim is drawn to the width like a magnet. He throws his hands at the ball with his feet nailed to the crease. He can only drag a thick inside edge back onto the stumps. Udana and Sri Lanka won't mind this one bit. One can't force shots on this sluggish track

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman run out (de Silva/Perera) 11 (19b 2x4 0x6) SR: 57.89

dismissalComment.html: What's happened there? Looks like we have a run out, yes he's short of his ground, just short, but should really have been run out by a mile. Pushed towards point and he takes off with the shot for a non existent run, Mushfiqur says no but it's too late, except the fielder from slip who hared across to pick the ball up sends the throw back in blind, on the turn and the keeper does superbly to first collect it and then drag it back on to the stumps just in the nick of time

dismissalText.commentary: Taijul Islam run out (Perera/Pradeep) 3 (9b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: lifter outside off from around the wicket, Taijul wants to slug it over midwicket, but does not touch it. Mushfiqur hares across for the bye, but Taijul is ball-watching and is late to respond. Kusal gathers the ball and passes it to Pradeep, who nails the stumps with an overarm throw to catch Taijul short by an inch or two. Mushfiqur is seething and gives the departing Taijul and earful

dismissalComment.html: Another cutter from Mustafizur, this one nabs Avishka. He rolls his fingers across this short ball outside off. It kicks up at Avishka, who is early into the pull as well. He winds up splicing a catch to Tamim running to his right from mid-on. Played, Avishka. It was good fun

commentTextItems.html: full on middle, lofts it over mid-on, gets to fifty, a very composed fifty, and helps Sri Lanka seal the series, their maiden ODI series win at home in 44 months

commentPostTextItems.html: That's all from us. Thanks for joining, good night.

Dimuth Karunaratne: We've done very well, we heard we've won after 44 months at home. Bowlers did a great job, the spinners in particular, Akila and Dananjaya. Akila was coming back after a long time, he did a great job. Avishka went for it in the beginning, unfortunately missed his hundred.

Tamim Iqbal: We won an important toss, we knew the wicket was going to spin. We needed to start well, 50 for four doesn't help but the way we bowled even 300 would not have been enough. We had our moments, can't go back to the players we don't have. We just weren't ready to do the hard work, we chose the easy option.
Avishka Fernando is the man of the match: I don't mind opening or batting at No.3, whatever the team requires. Disappointed to miss out on hundred but hope to correct it in future.

Mathews: Yeah, I mean, we haven't played very good cricket for the past two years, we have disappointed the fans. The wicket wasn't easy, thought Kusal played brilliantly after Avishka's brilliant knock.

Not the easiest pitch, as the work-man like innings of Mushfiqur confirmed but Bangladesh bowlers made it easier for Sri Lanka and weren't helped by their fielders' shoddy show. Young Avishka Fernando, however, made a mockery of whatever difficulties he was faced with. In imperious form, he capitalised on inconsistent bowling and made the world take note every time he struck a boundary or six. His rapid 82, replete with carefree drives and glorious pulls - although he fell to the stroke - set the chase up, and Mathews and Mendis ensured the good work wasn't wasted, to help Sri Lanka seal the series, their first in ODIs at home in 44 months.

dismissalText.long: c Tamim Iqbal b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Avishka Fernando c Tamim Iqbal b Mustafizur Rahman 82 (75b 9x4 2x6) SR: 109.33

dismissalComment.html: Another cutter from Mustafizur, this one nabs Avishka. He rolls his fingers across this short ball outside off. It kicks up at Avishka, who is early into the pull as well. He winds up splicing a catch to Tamim running to his right from mid-on. Played, Avishka. It was good fun

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Soumya Sarkar b Mustafizur Rahman 30 (34b 3x4 0x6) SR: 88.23

dismissalComment.html: full and outside off, Kusal drills it on the up... straight to short cover. Driven into the lap of Soumya Sarkar, and that's another opening for Bangladesh
